#summary How to run the console and Symja Swing application

== The Symja Swing GUI application ==

== The console application ==
In the folder where you've unzipped the console application, run a command similar to this:
{{{
C:\Java\jdk1.6.0\jre\bin\java -classpath meconsole001.jar;commons-logging-1.1.1.jar;log4j-1.2.11.jar org.matheclipse.core.eval.Console
}}}

The following console session appears:
{{{
org.matheclipse.core.eval.Console [options]

Program arguments: 
  -h or -help                  print this message
  -f or -file <filename>       use given file as input script
  -d or -default <filename>    use given textfile for system rules
To stop the program type: 
exit<RETURN>
To continue an input line type '\' at the end of the line.
****+****+****+****+****+****+****+****+****+****+****+****+
>>> 1+1
In [1]: 1+1
Out[1]: 2
>>> D[Sin[x],x]
In [2]: D[Sin[x],x]
Out[2]: Cos[x]
>>> 
}}}

==Features available in the latest SVN version==
With the {{{-f}}} or {{{-file}}} program argument, you can run a default script on startup of the console or Symja application:
{{{
 -f C:\temp\mymath.script
}}}

With the {{{-d}}} or {{{-default}}} program argument, the default pattern-matching math rules which are implemented in the [http://code.google.com/p/symja/source/browse/trunk/matheclipse-core/src/main/java/System.mep System.mep] file are replaced by your own rules:
{{{
 -default C:\temp\mysystem.mep
}}}
